Key Match Events: Sam Curran hits leg stump but somehow doesn't dislodge the bail.
Dawid Malan's 140 set victory up, with Jonny Bairstow's 52 and 82 from Joe Root helping the defending champions to a target of 365
Reece Topley took 4 for 43, including 4 wickets for 43 runs in the chase.
Mushfiqur Rahim's 61-ball fifty to steady Bangladesh.
Das goes! Litton Das falls for a valiant 76.
Topley off the mark, removing Tanzid Hasan and then Najmul Shanto caught at point.
Shoriful Islam's exceptional comeback, taking 3 wickets in the last 5 overs for 29 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh requires 259 from 31 overs to win
England's seamers struggled towards the end of their innings, losing 8 for 98 in the final 12.4 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: England bank open their account in the 2023 World Cup
England move on to Delhi where they will face Afghanistan on Sunday.
For Bangladesh, they are back in action on Friday in Chennai against New Zealand.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tanzid Hasan averages 6.66 in his first six innings, which is one of the worst starts by a Bangladeshi opener.
Topley has been lethal against left-handers throughout his ODI career, averaging 18.43 against them compared to 28.41 against right-handers.
Others: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side.
Bangladesh's opener Tanzid Hasan averages 6.66 in his first six innings.
